qas.question: What was the major cause of the separation between the Luftwaffe and the other military structure?
What did Goring do because of his fear of Hitler?
What year did Goring display the Luftwaffe's advanced equipment?
In what city did Goring display the advance equipment?
Who's bombing program did Goring abandon in 1939?

context: The deliberate separation of the Luftwaffe from the rest of the military structure encouraged the emergence of a major "<a0_0>communications gap<a0_0/>" between Hitler and the Luftwaffe, which other factors helped to exacerbate. For one thing, Göring's fear of Hitler led him to falsify or <a1_0>misrepresent what information<a1_0/> was available in the direction of an uncritical and over-optimistic interpretation of air strength. When Göring decided against continuing <a4_0>Wever<a4_0/>'s original heavy bomber programme in 1937, the Reichsmarschall's own explanation was that Hitler wanted to know only how many bombers there were, not how many engines each had. In July <a2_0>1939<a2_0/>, Göring arranged a display of the Luftwaffe's most advanced equipment at <a3_0>Rechlin<a3_0/>, to give the impression the air force was more prepared for a strategic air war than was actually the case.
